(1 comment)
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as b8cf46b885fe83cd4c6b644a1105131af7bc5e08

As `PLDM-stack: Adding sensor monitoring section` the terminus should have the `Terminus Name`. This patch set support get the `Terminus name` from top most entity aux name PDRs.

The `Terminus name` is required to create the inventory path, sensor D-Bus. 

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/docs/+/47252/34/designs/pldm-stack.md#433
The patch set will be updated to use API, struct and constant in https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/72099
Done
Perhaps we could provide an API in libpldm that calculates this value to avoid this mess at the call-site?
These three lines are just used to calculate `decodedPdrSize`. And they just do some simple plus/subtract with known value. So we don't need to add the API to do those simple steps.

I know what they're for 😊 However, it's tedious to require all callers to perform this calculation: it's one that's specific to the libpldm data structures. I prefer you provide an API for this in libpldm so the call-sites of `decode_entity_auxiliary_names_pdr()` aren't a mess of tedious and error-prone arithmetic.

I don't think there are much caller will call the `decode_entity_auxiliary_names_pdr` API. Even though, calculate the parameter to input to one API is required.
The `decode_entity_auxiliary_names_pdr` is implemented to catch the wrong input from user so I don't think we need more API.
Alright. If I see more instances of this arithmetic creeping in, I'll be pushing for this kind of solution again.
Is there a more appropriate way to do this in C++ (possibly `std::vector<char>(decodedPdrSize)` if that handles alignment as we need?)
I expect you should be using a C++-style cast here.
Done
Is there a more appropriate way to do this in C++? `std::vector<pldm_entity_auxiliary_name>(decodedPdr->name_string_count)`?

Why is the cast necessary? The returned pointer is already of the correct type:

https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/container/vector/data
Done
Why is this necessary?
Removed.
The patch set is available for review.

@Thu Changes look good, few comments on the patch set.

Also, Can you please improve the commit message, I believe this patchset does only the terminus name handling which is part of Entity AUX Name PDRs handling right? Can we be more focused on terminus handling in the commit message?
Updated.
I guess we have standard C++ template libraries for this - std::char_traits Can we leverage it?
Done
can we make use of std::optional std::string and return std::nullopt rather than ""?
Done
if(!tName.empty())
Done
can we make it an inline function?
Done
typo
Done
EntityName terminusName{}; ?
Done
Verified with meta-arm-evb system and works well.
null check missing, this could crash if entityAuxiliaryNames is null.
Done
this does not seem right ? instance numbers in pldm are always relative - one can have an instance number 0 as well for the system right ?

Look that the example in the DSP0248 V1.2.2, the `entityInstanceNumber` always start at `1`. In Ampere, we are also using `1` as start number of entityInstance.
At lines, the same DSP0248,
```
974 container entity. For example, referring to Figure 8, containerID 123 represents physical Chassis 1 (where
975 instance number 1 is defined relative to SYSTEM).
```
So As my opinion, the instance number of `SYSTEM` should be 1.

The other solution can be "removing `key.instanceIdx == 1` condition" because there is only one `overall system container` in one terminus.

Yeah the spec does not clearly say about it that it has to always start from 1.

per spec:

```
The Entity Instance Number is a value that could be used when instantiating CIM 
objects or presenting PLDM data as part of the "name" of the managed object. For
example, if a processor entity has an EntityInstance Number of "1", the expectation
is that the entity would be presented as “Processor 1”.The assignment of Entity
Instance Number values under a given Container ID is left up to the implementation.
However, it is typical that Entity Instance Number values are allocated
sequentially starting from 0 or 1 for a given Entity Type under the Container ID.
```

Although i dont disagree that it can start with 1, spec also vaguely says that it can be 0 as well (depends on implementation). So i would probably think removing the check `key.instanceIdx == 1` would be a better option.Probably add a comment mentioning that There is only "one system container".
Done
ensure that entityNames is not empty before accessing the 0th element. this could result in crash as well.
Done
started to see this pattern in couple of places now, do you think its worth to move this logic to a util function ? rather than repeating it everywhere ?
Done
inline void setTerminusName(std::string name) `noexcept` ?
Done
std::move(name) could reduce one copy here.
do we really want to store this in a class variable ? i dont see any necessity for it in this commit (dont see any code using it as such).. whats the purpose of filling it without using it ?
Done

I updated code in line 
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/72610/11/platform-mc/terminus.cpp#164
to use `setTerminusName()`.

About variable `terminusName`, As my opinion, the terminus name from `Entity Aux Name PDRs` should be store for future using as the commit message.

This is also why the API `set/getTerminusName` is added.

Got it, but can we check in this part of the code only when we are using it. Check ing in this code without actually using it makes it a dead code.

The ideal practice is that we dont check in code for future purpose, we directly put the code when we are using it.
I removed `setTerminusName`. About `getTerminusName`, we need it to get the private variable `terminusName`.
you could use string_view here , that could avoid another copy while returning the string.
doxygen missing
Done
Done
can we use std::string_view instead ?
Done
typo
Done
std::string_view ?
const reference ?
API trim the substring in `name` so I don't think we can add `const`.
Done
